headline: Shrimp Linguine
description: This shrimp linguine recipe with parsley, basil, and thyme in a dreamy garlic and cream sauce is great for a family dinner and good enough for guests!
name: Shrimp Linguine

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.

Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic, and sauté briefly to release flavor. Add cream; heat just to boiling, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low; stir in shrimp, parsley, basil, and thyme. Continue cooking until shrimp are just heated through; remove sauce from heat.
Drain pasta and toss lightly with cream sauce. Add Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper to taste; toss again and serve.

review.reviewBody: This was a hit with my famiy which gave me a lot of credit too :-) Simple ingredients and easy to follow instructions. Longest time was chopping up the herbs... Highly recommend!
Delicious!! Ingredients lessened due to only for me. I used dried herbs and cut the shrimp into bite size pieces. Definitely make again!! Thank you.
very tasty recipe. will make again.

I found the original recipe to be too strong on parsley. I'm lactose intolerant so I skipped the cream and added white wine and followed another comment by boiling the shrimp in cayenne water. I was much more impressed the second time!
Was surprised by how easy and delicious! Made it for Valentine's day dinner.
Love how quick and easy it was to make. It was sooo good! I added chicken and mushrooms to it because my daughter wont eat shrimp.
delicious! super easy! i added halved grape tomatoes and some crushed red pepper to spice it up, will definitely make this dish again!

I followed directions exactly and the Parm. Cheese clumped up. My guest even asked me if it was goat cheese. It tasted okay.. very mild almost no taste. I would spice with up with cayenne pepper or something. i will go back to using my old recipe for this dish. And I wont do a new dish when company is coming over. Bad call on my part.
I made it and it was delicious. However I always add a little more garlic than any recipe calls for, and I did so here as well. Also, I added more parsley, basil, and steamed asparagus.
Like another cook, I boiled the shrimp with about 1/4c Creole Seasoning.
I mixed a teaspoon of corn starch with water and thickened the sauce slightly. The sauce is light and lively and the recipe is awesome!

Love this recipe waaaay better than I expected for something so simple, I did add Slap Ya Mama seasoning to the shrimp to give it a lil extra something. Added green and red peppers honestly didn’t even need them, just added them so they didn’t go to waste in the fridge. But I added them towards the end so it didn’t really pick up the flavor, overall the meal was amazing!
Definitely adding to the rotation. Based on a comment, I added chili flakes for a little heat.

This was easy and delicious!!!! Do not substitute the heavy whipping cream, it makes the dish. In fact, you can add just a little more! I did strain the garlic out of the cream so not to bite into pieces of garlic. For the shrimp, I purchased the Tequila Lime Shrimp from Costco; already seasoned and tasted great! It’s a favorite and will be used often.
good recipe, only thing was 16oz was too much pasta. I would go with 12oz and I doubled the garlic and added a jalapeño during the simmer with garlic. oh and quarter cup more cheese

Easy and delicious with two minor changes. I cooked shrimp in hot cast iron skillet for a minute until starting to be opaque them removed from skillet. Cooked remaining ingredients with a dash or two of white wine vinegar. Trust me in the vinegar :). Easy and delicious!

i made this just as the recipe said and it was delicious! Only thing I changed was I didn't use all of the pasta, I wish I'd have saved some of the pasta water to add at the end to make it a little creamier. Definitely a keeper!
Delish! Made exactly as recipe directs, but had to sub dried basil for fresh as I was out. I cook for my hubby, two sons and my mother in law....Not easy to please us all, but this one did the trick!

This dish was very easy and delicious! Like others, I used half and half instead of heavy cream. It was light and tasty. I also added some chili pepper for a little “kick”. The family loved it! I will definitely make this again.

Amazing recipe made it almost as directed besides the cream didn’t have any so I added flour to butter in the beginning and milk when cream was called for. Did season it according to my family’s likes it’s was delicious quick and easy thank you for the recipe
big hit in our family
What a great and easy to make dish! I add diced tomatoes and sea salt.
Delicious as the recipe’s ingredients stated. Quick and simple.
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! My family and I were fighting over who would get the remaining leftovers. LOL!
I didn’t have parsley so I used rosemary and it was amazing. Super easy meal I will definitely make it again

Really good. I made a few edits to suit my family. I used a can of coconut milk instead of the milk, used margarine instead of the regular butter, doubled up the herbs and used half fresh and half dried. I added dill & lemon to give it some tang. I also added cayenne for the extra kick. Also I used mini shrimp so they were in every bite. Turned out really nice
A little less parsley and parmesan cheese.
Delicious. Everyone enjoyed it

Just made this for dinner. It was a big hit! Next time I’ll add some broccoli to it for added health benefits. Would like for it say what temperature to cook the heavy cream at unless I missed that somewhere. I don’t usually cook with cream. Thank you.

My family enjoyed this, but didn't go back for seconds. It seemed a bit heavy and drier than we like. Overall though, very good. I used both shrimp and scallops and they cooked perfectly in the sauce. I will likely make again, but try to lighten it up a bit.

It was a hit! We didn’t have basil but Italian seasoning worked well. Also subbed the linguine for penne. If you want a bit more flavor, I suggest doubling the amount of spices. This meal has easily made its way to our dinner rotation.
Superb! We added some zucchini, and substituted Parmesan with Asiago. This will definitely be the next thing I serve to guests!
This was delicious! I added sautéed chicken breast slices with the shrimp. The family loved it!
I will definitely make it again. I added mushrooms and capers to it and it was delicious!
This recipe is excellent, it’s a new Lenten favorite.
Followed the recipe exactly, except for adding some red pepper flake to add a bit of kick and the family loved it!
The whole family loved it. Easy to cook and quick! Great taste.
Very yummy!

Homemade sauce like a pro!! I added in some Philadelphia cream cheese 1/3 the fat! I also added extra shrimp and garlic why not!! The family did enjoy this and why wouldn’t they all this Italian goodness is a winner in our family.
Sooooo yummy!! Pleasantly surprised!!
Added a little lemon juice. Delicious.
It was a little bland !
Very good
Absolutely wonderful. My wife (who is Sicilian) thought it was really good and asked if I hd saved the recipe.
This was delicious. I kept the sauce amount the same but halved the pasta for just the 2 of us and it was perfect. I used frozen pre-cooked shrimp and added some spinach in at the end for color.
Excellent. thought the sauce was to thin, but it thickens up when the parmesan is added . Definitely will make again.
My husband loved it. I made as directed but didn’t have fresh parsley, so I used fresh basil. Delish!

Used the tip by someone else regarding boiling the shrimp first for 3 minutes then putting them in ice cold water to stop the cooking. It made the shrimp much better. Like everyone else, I tweaked the recipe to my liking. However, this recipe was a great base!
Quick and easy and really good! Thank you!
Chef Granddaughter made this for the family. It was really flavorable and a hit with her siblings and Grandparents. Will do again.
A little bland 1st time I made it. also very dry, need to double the sauce.

The Good: Can't wrong with butter and heavy cream! The Bad: very oily/greasy because of all the butter. Also, I followed advice of others and added red pepper, about a teaspoon. I also doubled the garlic. I'd make it again but cut back on butter and maybe thin the sauce with a little of the pasta water or maybe some chicken broth. Also this does create a good base to sub the shrimp with chicken.
5 stars Following POOHMOM2’s review I added garlic and onion while the frozen butter melted, then asparagus then the rest of the ingredients.
Delicious my family loved it; will make it again

As written, it’s pretty boring, not a lot of flavor. Needed a lot more seasoning, even after I pumped up the volume on herbs and added some sautéed mushrooms and onions. I’ll try a different recipe next time.
My husband and I loved this! The sauce was gorgeous and delish!
This was a wonderful dish! I added just a pinch of cayenne pepper otherwise followed the recipe exactly. It was delicious!!
I cooked raw shrimp until tender, otherwise I followed the recipe almost exactly!
So easy and delicious! I will be making this again. I did add cayenne pepper to the water of my shrimp boil.

Agree this is great base. Added garlic powder, onion powder and a bit more whipping cream and cooked on med stirring often until cream thickened. Then added shrimp after cream was thicker. Will even use this as just a cream sauce fir pasta without tye shrimp. Very yummy.
I had to make myself from eating it all! It was like it was straight from a restaurant kitchen but it only took a short amount of time to make! definitely becoming a staple around here.
Great and simple recipe, I used angel hair pasta and cherry tomatoes.

I added some red pepper flakes to boost the flavor. The dish
was easy to make & my guests were very impressed.
I had to improvise a few ingredients but it was delicious.
Quick and easy! so delicious!! family loved it!

My family loved it, but I did think it fell on the "bland" side a bit, even though I increased the garlic, added white wine, and offered lemon wedges and red pepper flakes on the table. As previously stated, it's a good base recipe, but needs tweaking (such as not so much parsley and uncooked shrimp). I would cook it again, though. Chicken could be really good with it instead of shrimp.
It’s just so good when it touches your lips!
Recipe was quick and easy to make. We enjoyed it.
I added 1 chicken breast along with asparagus. It was delicious!! My girlfriend and I had seconds! We’ll definitely make it again.
Excellent added cherry tomatoes and mozzarella cut recipe in half just the two of us
This is a delicious dish. I added a few more shrimp and made a bit more sauce. My husband loved it and I will definitely be making this again??
Came out great. I’m not an expert but it turned out delish. Family really enjoyed it.
So easy! Made this recipe twice and it was a hit!
Super quick, easy and DELISH!!! I substituted spaghetti squash for the linguine (trying to be Keto) and it was just fabulous. I used fresh jumbo shrimp and cooked them befor

I made this with the Argentinian frozen shrimp from Trader Joe’s, which has a nice sweetness. I followed the recipe exactly other than a little less parsley since the bag of shrimp was only 1 lb. I served it with sauteed Brussels sprouts. Delicious and easy!

I did make some changes but think it would be excellent, if extremely rich and perhaps a tiny bit bland, as written. My main complaint is that it does not make enough sauce for that amount of pasta — the amount of shrimp is fine but it needs more liquid. My changes: 2% milk plus cornstarch, 1/3 the butter (plus a generous spoonful of light sour cream at the end). I doubled the garlic, used dried basil and subbed a small amount of green onion for the parsley (my parsley was a little sad looking), plus I added a few generous pinches of Cajun seasoning. People put their own Parmesan on. Oh yes, and I added some sliced sautéed mushrooms; I bet asparagus would also be great.

I followed the recipe, however, I missed where it stated "cooked" shrimp. I didn't notice it until the next day when I was reading the recipe again. 
I used fresh shrimp and cooked them in the cream for about 3 to 4 minutes. I then added the basil, parsley and thyme and finished the recipe as stated. The shrimp was tender and delicious. My husband and I really enjoyed this delicious meal.
I will definitely make this recipe again and I will try it with the chicken also.
I doubled the recipe and it was a hit cooked just as written. A keeper for sure.
It
Add cayenne pepper, crushed red pepper, curry powder
Turned out amazing! Followed the recipe exactly.
I made this last night for supper and it's delicious! I actually forgot to put in the parmesan cheese but honestly it doesn't need it. Served it with a simple salad and garlic bread, so good!
Used 4 cloves of Garlic and 1 cup of Parmesan. I also added a good handful of frozen spinach to the sauce as it was bubbling.
Honestly, the first recipe I've made where I didn't change a thing and everyone loved it. Will make it again and again.

This was very tasty and easy as well. I wanted to incorporate veggies into the meal so I cut up onions and red peppers and mushrooms to cook with the garlic. Other than that I followed the recipe. Served it over linguine with parmesan cheese.

It was great. Will make again. Looked up recipe since I had shrimp that had to be used up. Only had 1/2 & 1/2 and dried basil & angel hair pasta. Probably used a bit more cheese. Used a sprinkle of red pepper as some said it was bland . Nice and easy and quick. Can easily make your own substitutions from this basic recipie or use as is.

it was easy enough to make. I made only half the recipe, since there are only two of us left at home. There are also spaghetti noodles, because I am the gluten word ??. After finishing it, I noticed it was missing a little flavor, so I added some German spices and a little gravy binder, because it was a little to runny for my dinosaur tastebuds. Will try it again though, with the whole gang here in the next few months.

All star recipe. I too used half & half and found it plenty rich. Mincing the garlic brings out more of a kick. Precooked shrimp were tricky as I wanted them to be hoy but not overlooked. Make sure they are at room temperature and only go for 60-90 s condos. 
Rule #512?? One can never use too much Parmesan cheese
Easy to make and delicious didn't change anything I just have dry basil and parsley but was yummy my family like it..
I used milk instead of cream and added some cornstarch with water to thicken the sauce and it tasted delicious

I absolutely loved it! I didn't use any fresh ingredients, all my ingredients were dry flakes (basil, thyme, parsley etc.) However i used about 2-3 tbsp worth of dry basil and parsley flakes. I kept the measure for the thyme the same. I added about 1 tbsp of salt and half tbsp of pepper and it came out fabulous. At first i was wondering why the sauce was thin, but after you add the Parmesan it will thicken to an alfredo. Tasted like red lobster!

Sooooo quick and easy. i could not believe how good it was. just so you know anytime i cook anything i always add more seasoning than it says in the recipe . And i used fresh chopped garlic. but besides that i didn't change much.

Excellent and fast! Mine looked much different than the photo; more fresh, less creamy. I followed Valerie's recommendation and cooked my shrimp separately with a couple of strong shakes of chili powder, just 3 minutes. I also used fresh basil and parsley. There was a tablespoon of butter on the bottom of the pot, so I might lighten the butter a bit next time.
Idk if I did something wrong or if this dish is supposed to have a ton of herbs and spices. It was still pretty good, but next time, I'm halving the amount of parsley.
So creamy and delicious especially when made with fresh shrimp!
Delicious and simple. New to cooking people...be sure to watch the timing of the shrimp

The only changes I made to this delicious and very easy recipe was I used quite a bit more fresh garlic than the recipe called for and I used bow tie pasta. The other reviews stating the recipe was bland were not accurate in my opinion. The thyme and basil were perfect. My 5 year old granddaughter loved it. Will make this again.
Very easy, used cooked and ready shrimp. My husband ate this basically all by himself and my plate. He said it was one of my best dishes I've made.
Very good. Changed it up a bit with 1% milk and flour instead of whipping cream. And a little different spices.
